children.subject: Thank you for a reply! I will definitely self-study CS 182.
Looks like a good plan for someone geared towards industry. I would add maybe CS 182 because the assignments are rather applied, but if you can't then just self-study cs231n.stanford.edu

history.content:
Hello, I am a transfer student and an international student. I want to work on the ML field in the future, but have not decided which field I want to focus on yet. I am thinking of Neural network or AI now. Currently, my intended major is Data Science. I took CS 61A, Data 8, INFO 188 last semester. I am taking CS 61B, Prob 140, AC course this semester. I heard that it is hard to find a job in the ML field without a master degree. So I am thinking of focusing on more SWE stuff, or changing my intended major as CS and whole my course plan. Then get a job, work 2-3 years, and pursue a master degree if I can.

My course plan is taking Data 100, CS 170, CS 162, DATA 102(or CS 189), COG SCI 1, COG SCI 131, CS 188.

My transferred courses are MATH 1A, 1B, 53, 54, 55.

Any suggestion on course plan or my major decision? Thank you!
history.subject: ML course plan Advice?
